data.title: Kills/Deaths ratio
data.body: It would be interesting to see the kills/deaths ratio in the endgame statistics. Somehow the efficiency of the player.

Like "you can download the latest release on [copying/pasting the URI of the OpenRA website]".

data.title: D2k - More Crate PowerUps
data.body: I added explode crate to D2K. I'm sorry to lots of commits. I made this on my android tablet and this is very hard. I can't squash them now and i'm not sure does it work?

data.title: Add groundwork for heightmapped terrain.
data.body:
This pr adds support for per-tile template data, and converts the minimap color, ramp type, and cell height data for the TS temperate tileset.  It also adds support for the extra sprite data in tmp(ts), and adds a widget for rendering terrain templates.

These features aren't used yet, but can be tested on my [ingame map editor](https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/tree/ingame-map-editor) branch.

A screenshot showing where this is heading:

![editor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/4839174/5180dd92-5ffa-11e4-8309-121d4429d824.png)

data.title: Game does not render anything - I hear sound, but see nothing
data.body:
Heya!

I'm using linux with SDL2 (2.0.3-r100). 
My Graphic-card: VGA compatible controller: NVIDIA Corporation G86M [Quadro NVS 140M](rev a1)

So yes, I have an old laptop. Anyways. Normally I have no rendering problems and games work perfectly for me.

```
$> openra
Platform is Linux
Using SDL 2 with OpenGL renderer
Desktop resolution: 1280x800
Using resolution: 1280x720
Detected OpenGL version: 3.3
Using OpenAL sound engine
Using default device
Available mods:
    cnc: Tiberian Dawn (release-20140722)
    d2k: Dune 2000 (release-20140722)
    modchooser: Mod Chooser ({DEV_VERSION})
    ra: Red Alert (release-20140722)
Loading mod: cnc
```

A black fullscreen appears for less than a second and then I'm back on my desktop, but hearing the sound from the menu.

I read a bit about pseudo-fullscreen and real-fullscreen and maybe my WindowManager doesn't like the resolution change of real fullscreen. I don't know.

I've tried the startup with an empty settings.yaml first, then I added Game.mod=cnc, because I thought it might be the modchooser. No luck.
Then I tried to force real full screen with Graphics.Mode=Fullscreen and Graphics.FullScreenSize=1280,720
Also no luck.

my current settings.yaml looks like this:

```
Player:

Game:
    Mod: cnc
    NewsFetchedDate: 2014-10-29 01-00-00

Sound:

Graphics:
    Mode: Fullscreen
    FullscreenSize: 1280,720

Server:
    AllowPortForward: False

Debug:

Keys:

Irc:
```

Because I cannot use the graphics settings from the running game, I'd like to have more information about how to change the graphics settings using the settings.yaml. The settings.yaml doesn't seem to be well documented :/

But maybe a windowed mode would work for me.

Thanks in advance.

Phil

data.title: Aircraft can hide from missiles outside the map
data.body:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5687 introduced this new and exploitable behavior where missiles will self-destruct before hitting helicopters and planes that are located outside the map boundaries which is terrible when someone does places them there on purpose. The only fix seems to completely disallow any aircraft to hide outside the map. That will also fix the invisibility problem.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/5587509-aircraft-can-hide-from-missiles-outside-the-map?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Copy Mods.Common.dll to the correct location after build.
data.body: This was still broken when compiling using Monodevelop / Xamarin Studio.

data.title: Use INotifyBuildComplete for Production & AnnounceOnBuild
data.body:
Extend using INotifyBuildComplete to Production and have AnnounceOnBuild implement INotifyBuildComplete.

This gives AnnounceOnBuild correct behavior according to its name.

data.title: Multi-Monitor Usage?
data.body:
It would be intuitive to be able to use an additional monitor for a separate view-port/camera ala Supreme Commander perhaps.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/5539912-multi-monitor-usage?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fixed sound overlapping with full motion video clips
data.body: Followup of #6377, #6379 and #6748.

data.title: Fix the --png utility command.
data.body: Closes #6845. Regression was introduced by #6758.

data.title: Replaced the gem mine artwork
data.body:
Railmine does not work well together with the resource layer. This keeps it as a decorative element, but replaces the gem mine with new 1x1 artwork created by @MicroJOo.

![gem-mine](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/4783262/f572091e-5d1e-11e4-9c1d-3838609c6354.png)

data.title: OpenRA.Utility.exe ra --png will always spit out System.IO.FileNotFoundException
data.body: No matter how hard you try making it essentially unusable.

data.title: Added new maps to the Dune 2000 mod
data.body: Found two maps at http://resource.openra.net/maps/ that are detailed and contain enough space to build a base.

data.title: Removed maps with visual problems
data.body: Some have very obvious tile placement errors or look very cheap with repetitive cliffs etc. They served their time in the previous release. Essentially the same as https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6842 but for Dune 2000 and Tiberian Dawn.

data.title: Removed several maps from the Red Alert mod
data.body: As discussed in #5458 there are some problematic maps. Their size leads to performance or gameplay problems or their tile placement is not very polished. I added a new KotH map in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6841.

data.title: Added a new map Hopes Anchor
data.body: after a successful testplay with @pchote, @obrakmann and Ripley. See http://resource.openra.net/maps/1368/  by @NukemBro.

data.title: Smudges have tendency to be spawned on the cell south of impact
data.body:
Particularly noticeable in TS, because "south" means the cell south-west of the impact in this case.

Might actually be an issue with `Inaccuracy`, though.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/5530860-smudges-have-tendency-to-be-spawned-on-the-cell-south-of-impact?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.body:
Most of them crash because there is not a valid player.

<bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fix transport passenger shroud revealing
data.body: This fixes passengers revealing fog at their original load point for a tick when they are unloaded.

data.title: Polish GDI01 and 02.
data.body:
This fixes the landing craft in both missions, and includes additional tweaks to GDI01:
- Removes unbuildable concrete wall from production palette.
- Fixes chat sounds and reinforcement notification overlapping FMV.
- Cuts down the excessive starting forces to encourage base building.

data.title: Polish nod01
data.body:
- Script initial unit entry.
- Centre the camera on the initial starting point
- Give additional e3 reinforcements to clear the village.
- Catch and display an error if CallLuaFunc throws.

data.title: GDI01 and Nod01 starting forces should move in from off map
data.body: This would be an easy polish win.

data.title: Mission objectives shouldn't be added until after the intro videos are complete
data.body:
The current behaviour causes the annoying text blip sound at the start of the FMV, and the objectives time out of the chat display by the time some FMVs have completed playing.

This can be easily fixed by moving the objective setup inside a fmv-completion function.

data.title: Disable missions that define bogus rules.
data.body: Fixes #6818.

data.title: RenderNameTag improvements
data.body:
Could be nice if RenderNameTag supported more than just the owner's name, such as:
- Owner name (eg Playername)
- Actor type (eg 3TNK)
- Custom string (eg Chitzkoi)
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/5506454-rendernametag-improvements?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Dispose of graphics resources deterministically
data.body:
#5923 is back.

Speculative fix for #5116 by implementing IDisposable on Texture, FrameBuffer and VertexBuffer rather than relying on the finalizer to do the work since the non-determinism of finalization means these resources could be hanging around for an unbounded length of time before being released. I don't have any particular proof that this will fix the out-of-memory issue, it just seems like it could be a possible cause.

To verify, you can stick some console logging in the finalizers for these methods. On bleed you should notice a lot of activity as you load assets (loading, switching mods, choosing maps, starting & ending a game). This PR fixes all but one inconsequential leak as far as I can tell (the leak is the static SheetBuilder in SprintFont, but since the textures are needed forever it hardly matters).

data.title: Per-Player handicap
data.body:
Maybe players can choose a handicap for themselves for extra challenge against weaker opponents?

Maybe they can set their tech level lower then the other players just for starters?

<bountysource-plugin>
